transcript.title: Commonwealth Ombudsman
transcript.content:
I am pleased to announce the appointment by the Governor-General of Professor John McMillan as Commonwealth Ombudsman for a term of five years commencing on 17 March 2003.

Professor McMillan is a distinguished academic with extensive knowledge and experience in administrative law. He holds the Alumni Chair in Administrative Law at the Australian National University and was a founding member of the Australian Institute of Administrative Law.

I am confident that he brings outstanding skills and experience to the office of Commonwealth Ombudsman.

A copy of Professor McMillan's curriculum vitae is attached.

I would also like to acknowledge once again the contribution of the outgoing Ombudsman Mr Ron McLeod AM on his retirement after nearly 45 years of distinguished service to the Commonwealth.

CURRICULUM VITAE

NAME:

John Denison McMILLAN

DATE OF BIRTH:

17 September 1949

NATIONALITY:

Australian

EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor of Arts (ANU, 1970)

Bachelor of Laws H2A (ANU, 1972)

PRESENT POSITION:

Professor, holding the Alumni Chair in Administrative Law at the Australian National University

RELEVANT PAST EXPERIENCE:

1995-2002 Member, Centre for International and Public Law

Since 1997 Consultant to the Clayton Utz Government Services Group

1995-1997 Deputy Dean (Students), Law Faculty, ANU Responsible for many aspects of student administration

Founding member and later President of the Australian Institute of Administrative Law (AIAL)

1983-2000 Lecturer/Senior Lecturer/Reader in Law

1982-1983 Visiting Fellow, Australian Graduate School of Management

1979-1980 Principal Investigation Officer in the Office of the Commonwealth Ombudsman

Author of articles and legal opinions about the role of the Ombudsman
